name: Fractured Books of the Bible Quiz | Fractured Books | 20 Questions

questions.explanation:
Genesis.

	Genesis is the first book of the Bible.  It starts with "In the beginning God created the Heaven and earth." This tells a lot of history, including how the world was created, first people, first murder, the great flood, and the story of Abraham.

Leviticus.

	Leviticus is the third book of the Old Testament.  This is the book of the Bible that is associated with the Law.  That is God's law not governmental law, although many countries base their laws on the Bible.

Deuteronomy.

	Deuteronomy is the fifth book of the Old Testament.

Nehemiah.

	Nehemiah was the cup bearer to King Artaxerxes.

Esther.

	Esther is the only book of the Bible that does not mention God anywhere. Esther helped save the Jewish race.

Ecclesiastes.

	The music group The Byrd's song "Turn, Turn, Turn" was taken from Ecclesiastes. The lyrics are To Everything (Turn, Turn, Turn)There is a season (Turn, Turn, Turn)And a time to every purpose, under Heaven A time to be born, a time to dieA time to plant, a time to reapA time to kill, a time to healA time to laugh, a time to weep To Everything (Turn, Turn, Turn)There is a season (Turn, Turn, Turn)And a time to every purpose, under Heaven A time to build up,a time to break downA time to dance, a time to mournA time to cast away stones, a time to gather stones together To Everything (Turn, Turn, Turn)There is a season (Turn, Turn, Turn)And a time to every purpose, under Heaven A time of love, a time of hateA time of war, a time of peaceA time you may embrace, a time to refrain from embracing To Everything (Turn, Turn, Turn)There is a season (Turn, Turn, Turn)And a time to every purpose, under Heaven A time to gain, a time to loseA time to rend, a time to sewA time for love, a time for hateA time for peace, I swear it's not too late This song is almost verbatim if you look at Ecclesiastes 3.

Isaiah.

	Isaiah was the son of Amoz.  He is the prophet who foretold of Jesus' birth.

Lamentations.

	Lamentations was written by Jeremiah, who was known as "the weeping prophet".

Ezekiel.

	Ezekiel is the prophet who foretold of the destruction of Jerusalem.

Habakkuk.

	Habakkuk was a minor prophet who's main theme was living by faith.

Malachi.

	Malachi confronts the Jews for becoming lax in their beliefs and practices in his book.

Matthew.

	Matthew is also known as Levi.

Luke.

	Luke was a physician before he became an apostle. It is also believed that Luke wrote the book of Acts.

Acts.

	The book of Acts is the book where we see the first Christian church.

Romans.

	Romans is the first of many letters written by Paul to various cities. The main theme of Romans is justification.

First Corinthians.

	I Corinthians 13 is known as the love chapter. There is four Greek words that mean love:agape - Unconditional lovephilia - Brotherly love (Friendship love)eros - passionate lovestorge - affectionate love (parental love)

Galatians.

	Galatia was located in central Anatolia. Anatolia was located in western Asia.

Titus.

	The book of Titus tells the duties of the elders in a church. Some churches also refer to them as bishops or deacons.

Philemon.

	Paul was imprisoned when he wrote this letter to Philemon. This was the shortest of all of Paul's epistles. Epistle is another word for letter.

Jude.

	Jude is the second to last book of the Bible making it book number 65.
